intro: Gyrocarpus americanus subsp. glaber, commonly known as the smooth gyrocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Hippocastanaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in moist, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive, spiny fruits that enclose the seeds. It has a woody stem and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. The subspecies glaber is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves, which set it apart from other subspecies within the species.
